info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 04 at 5:38PM PDT by NWS Reno
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact Interstate 80 between Trinity Junction and Oreana through 615 PM PDT... At 536 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles northeast of Trinity Junction, or 14 miles southwest of Lovelock, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail along with heavy rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Ponding of water on I-80. Locations impacted include... Lovelock, Oreana, Trinity Junction, Lovelock Derby Field Airport, Junction I 80 And Nv 396/857 (exit 112), Junction I 80 And U.S 95 (exit 83) and Toulon Peak. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
